commit_message:
Deprecate collector

The collector service and package is now removed and
doesn't have any effect and it's functionality is in the
graph service. [1]

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/17440/

[{'created': '2018-12-12 20:25:11.000000000', 'message': 'Bring up secondary IPs on member networks

up at member creation time.

commit_message:
Bring up secondary IPs on member networks

Octavia is plugging member networks, but only bringing up the first
fixed IP address on that network. This can mean that a secondary
fixed IP on the network, such as the IPv6 address is not brought
up at member creation time.

Conflicts:
        octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/osutils.py
        octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/test_plug.py

Change-Id: Ic5b19a303e53ab62875c4fc4be6ac03f926a6832
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Story: 2004113
Task: 27535
(cherry picked from commit b616cd5a33315713caf8a39c1bc86d427619e3e1)
(cherry picked from commit b7b7d75f66013339d0f8772b3a57dfd0bc13a876)

commit_message:
DNM: Test jobs running on bionic instead of xenial

We want to migrate to the latest Ubuntu LTS release
18.04 aka Bionic[1]. This is just a patch to find possible
issues for cinder-tempest-plugin gate jobs before the
real migration starts. cinder-tempest-plugin has only
one job 'cinder-tempest-plugin-lvm-lio' that is which
is derived from 'devstack' base job which is migrated
to Bionic in Depends-On patch.

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-November/000168.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/610977

Change-Id: I8aebffea71f183137da914ec2921b166f6fdfc72

commit_message:
DNM: Test jobs running on bionic instead of xenial

We want to migrate to the latest Ubuntu LTS release
18.04 aka Bionic[1]. This is just a patch to find possible
issues for python-brick-cinderclient-ext gate jobs
before the real migration starts.
python-brick-cinderclient-ext has only one job
'brick-cinderclient-dsvm-functional' which is
derived from 'devstack' base job which is migrated
to Bionic in Depends-On patch.

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-November/000168.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/610977

Change-Id: Iee6bc65f54ced2350dc31ed74c490943ca9b6545

commit_message:
DNM: Test jobs running on bionic instead of xenial

We want to migrate to the latest Ubuntu LTS release
18.04 aka Bionic. This is just a patch to find possible
issues for cinder gate jobs before the real migration
starts. Cinder has only one job which is derived from
'devstack' base job which is migrated to Bionic in
Depends-On patch.

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/610977

Change-Id: Ie978812917318a43b28989159cd999bb0c91aeba

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 21:57:06.000000000', 'message': 'Drop pre-cellsv2 compat in compute API.get()

This removes the nova-osapi_compute service version
compatibility check for cells v2 which was added in
Newton.

A "nova-status upgrade check" was added for that
in Rocky:

  Ie2bc4616439352850cf29a9de7d33a06c8f7c2b8

And it is also causing issues with functional tests
where instances are buried in cell0 and because we
don't use the instance mapping, we fail to find the
instance.

As a result of this, compute API tests that rely on
retrieving a real instance out of the database will
also need to make sure an associated instance mapping
record exists.

Change-Id: I11083aa3c78bd8b6201558561457f3d65007a177
Closes-Bug: #1800472

commit_message:
Drop pre-cellsv2 compat in compute API.get()

This removes the nova-osapi_compute service version
compatibility check for cells v2 which was added in
Newton.

A "nova-status upgrade check" was added for that
in Rocky:

  Ie2bc4616439352850cf29a9de7d33a06c8f7c2b8

And it is also causing issues with functional tests
where instances are buried in cell0 and because we
don't use the instance mapping, we fail to find the
instance.

As a result of this, compute API tests that rely on
retrieving a real instance out of the database will
also need to make sure an associated instance mapping
record exists.

Change-Id: I11083aa3c78bd8b6201558561457f3d65007a177
Closes-Bug: #1800472

commit_message:
Drop baremetal job template

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619337/ switched the jobs to a noop for
master and since this file is branched we no longer need to keep this
template definition in this project.

Change-Id: I191a44b6f0e44fe8cfb3d46831e64b15be9984ef

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 15:29:38.000000000', 'message': 'Sharing hypervisor /var/lib/ironic with ironic-conductor container

While puppet-config generation, ironic-conductor will call ironic::pxe
to copy files and create directories required for tftpboot and httpboot
to /varlib/ironic on container.

But /var/lib/ironic of hypervisor is not being shared with ironic-conductor,
the changes that were done on container are not present on hypervisor.

For ironic-inspector the previously generated configs are required to move
forward and apply its own puppet-configs.

In order to make the configs generated by ironic-conductor available to
ironic-inspector, hypervisor /var/lib/ironic must be shared with
ironic-conductor container as well while generating puppet-config.

Change-Id: I5ee1a78ea7b7681e0dc1387fc5af598919ecb397
Closes-Bug: 1795776
(cherry picked from commit 6b7f1384219a8dd37468f0ff7c8edbc729df4ff4)
'}]
commit_message:
Sharing hypervisor /var/lib/ironic with ironic-conductor container

While puppet-config generation, ironic-conductor will call ironic::pxe
to copy files and create directories required for tftpboot and httpboot
to /varlib/ironic on container.

But /var/lib/ironic of hypervisor is not being shared with ironic-conductor,
the changes that were done on container are not present on hypervisor.

For ironic-inspector the previously generated configs are required to move
forward and apply its own puppet-configs.

In order to make the configs generated by ironic-conductor available to
ironic-inspector, hypervisor /var/lib/ironic must be shared with
ironic-conductor container as well while generating puppet-config.

Change-Id: I5ee1a78ea7b7681e0dc1387fc5af598919ecb397
Closes-Bug: 1795776
(cherry picked from commit 6b7f1384219a8dd37468f0ff7c8edbc729df4ff4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 17:19:27.000000000', 'message': "Stop Logging Amphora Cert

Stop logging amphora cert for tasks:

octavia-failover-amphora-flow- \
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-generate-serverpem

And:
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-update-cert-expiration

This patch adds more exclusions to taskflow DynamicLoggingListener,
which logs task results when running in debug mode.

Failing Over a loadbalancer (SINGLE):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/C0ghBQCXBv6YXqR4YRUY/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/S4bezDTre4KU4oeQDrsF/

Failing Over a loadbalancer (ACTIVE_STANDBY):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/u9aQGvE64evYuYbcWvF4/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/BlJEqGYpHaZYu3LBww3g/

While writing this patch, I also tested for:
1. loadbalancer create with SINGLE topology.
2. loadbalancer create with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.
3. loadbalancer amphora failover with SINGLE topology.
4. loadbalancer amphora failover with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.

I didn't notice any cert prints for those cases.

I was not able to trigger the above-mentioned
octavia-update-cert-expiration, but we have a clear indication for
it in a log screenshot that I attached to the StoryBoard.

Story: 2004606
Task: 28503

Change-Id: I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864
(cherry picked from commit 7e8ece9474d0fec92c216ab26e5b143c68479f29)
(cherry picked from commit ec4c88e23ebeb786491158682f9a7dd42928f97a)
(cherry picked from commit 2bd9b68dd1a77723f0d62ac170172333a356aace)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop Logging Amphora Cert

Stop logging amphora cert for tasks:

octavia-failover-amphora-flow- \
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-generate-serverpem

And:
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-update-cert-expiration

This patch adds more exclusions to taskflow DynamicLoggingListener,
which logs task results when running in debug mode.

Failing Over a loadbalancer (SINGLE):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/C0ghBQCXBv6YXqR4YRUY/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/S4bezDTre4KU4oeQDrsF/

Failing Over a loadbalancer (ACTIVE_STANDBY):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/u9aQGvE64evYuYbcWvF4/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/BlJEqGYpHaZYu3LBww3g/

While writing this patch, I also tested for:
1. loadbalancer create with SINGLE topology.
2. loadbalancer create with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.
3. loadbalancer amphora failover with SINGLE topology.
4. loadbalancer amphora failover with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.

I didn't notice any cert prints for those cases.

I was not able to trigger the above-mentioned
octavia-update-cert-expiration, but we have a clear indication for
it in a log screenshot that I attached to the StoryBoard.

Story: 2004606
Task: 28503

Change-Id: I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864
(cherry picked from commit 7e8ece9474d0fec92c216ab26e5b143c68479f29)
(cherry picked from commit ec4c88e23ebeb786491158682f9a7dd42928f97a)
(cherry picked from commit 2bd9b68dd1a77723f0d62ac170172333a356aace)

commit_message:
Sharing hypervisor /var/lib/ironic with ironic-conductor container

While puppet-config generation, ironic-conductor will call ironic::pxe
to copy files and create directories required for tftpboot and httpboot
to /varlib/ironic on container.

But /var/lib/ironic of hypervisor is not being shared with ironic-conductor,
the changes that were done on container are not present on hypervisor.

For ironic-inspector the previously generated configs are required to move
forward and apply its own puppet-configs.

In order to make the configs generated by ironic-conductor available to
ironic-inspector, hypervisor /var/lib/ironic must be shared with
ironic-conductor container as well while generating puppet-config.

Change-Id: I5ee1a78ea7b7681e0dc1387fc5af598919ecb397
Closes-Bug: 1795776
(cherry picked from commit 6b7f1384219a8dd37468f0ff7c8edbc729df4ff4)

subject: Increase the cpu and memory resource limits for Ceph OSDs
messages:
[{'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-12-08 02:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-12-10 19:57:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If this is for the bluestore memory management and targets that came in with 12.2.9 would it not make more sense to define both the request and limit to the same value, so we move the pod into the guaranteed class? also it would be advisable to add some overhead over the default value (25%) so we don't kill pods prematurely if the target is overshot. it would also be good to add a note here that links to the config options that will have impact here."}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:09:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes 12.2.9+ introduced the cache changes for Bluestore memory management. 4GB is the maximum the cache will use, but it will contract and grow as required. Personally I'm fine with going out of the gate with a 5GB limit. I will change that in the next update."}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

seems fine though arbitrary :/'}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:21:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Yes 12.2.9+ introduced the cache changes for Bluestore memory
 > management. 4GB is the maximum the cache will use, but it will
 > contract and grow as required. Personally I'm fine with going out
 > of the gate with a 5GB limit. I will change that in the next
 > update.

Feedback i have is that it will exceed by up to 20% with current implementations"}, {'account_id': 29268, 'date': '2018-12-11 01:27:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-12-13 17:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26686, 'date': '2018-12-13 20:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-12-13 20:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-12-14 00:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Increase the cpu and memory resource limits for Ceph OSDs

The minimium requirements for a Ceph OSD have changed in the latest
Luminous release to accomodate Bluestore changes. We need to support
these changes as we look into upgrading Ceph to the latest Luminous
and beyond releases.

Change-Id: I3eddffe73cfd188ff012db7c74702de6921711e7

commit_message:
Ironic Inspector - disjoint ip range(s) for HA

Allow tht parameter IronicInspectorSubnets to specify
per-instance ip range(s) using hostname as key for each
list of ip ranges. For HA deployments use disjoint
address pools to avoid potential address conflict.

Implements: blueprint ironic-inspector-overcloud
Change-Id: Ifae513265b8c35d98012f14f951bac33ae90b66c

[{'created': '2018-12-13 02:49:39.000000000', 'message': 'Check if agent can reach neutron server

The ovs agent will install some basic drop flows first for the
physical bridge mappings during the init procedure. If message
queue is not connected, or neutron-servers are all down, real

commit_message:
Check if agent can reach neutron server

The ovs agent will install some basic drop flows first for the
physical bridge mappings during the init procedure. If message
queue is not connected, or neutron-servers are all down, real
traffic flows will not be refreshed anymore. This will cause
the data plane down if tenant network and provider network are
sharing the physical NICs.

This patch adds a RPC check during init L2 agent. When restart
the ovs-agent, if the MQ is OK and we have available neutron-server,
go next step. Otherwise, a rpc timeout will be raised. L2 agent
will start fail, physical bridge mapping drop flows will not be
installed. The original flows will not be replaced, so the traffic
can still work properly.

Closes-Bug: #1803919
Change-Id: Ie15cf625b3710eaf290d6aafecb3f65df664b9df
(cherry picked from commit 0385868848f8c18c8a37fd4c661d1b1a5078e044)

Check if agent can reach neutron server

The ovs agent will install some basic drop flows first for the
physical bridge mappings during the init procedure. If message
queue is not connected, or neutron-servers are all down, real
traffic flows will not be refreshed anymore. This will cause
the data plane down if tenant network and provider network are
sharing the physical NICs.

This patch adds a RPC check during init L2 agent. When restart
the ovs-agent, if the MQ is OK and we have available neutron-server,
go next step. Otherwise, a rpc timeout will be raised. L2 agent
will start fail, physical bridge mapping drop flows will not be
installed. The original flows will not be replaced, so the traffic
can still work properly.

commit_message:
Table name in "add_ip_rule" can be a string

In neutron.agent.linux.ip_lib.add_ip_rule, the "table" argument can be
an integer or a string ("default", "main", "local").

This parameter is incorrectly treated in "_make_pyroute2_args".

Change-Id: I0a50af5fe9b1550700e607eb680bb16e5044e8ef
Closes-Bug: #1807128

commit_message:
Note the aggregate allocation ratio restriction in scheduler docs

This borrows from the release note in change
I01f20f275bbd5451ace5c1e6f41ab38d488dae4e to document the
regression, introduced in Ocata, where allocation ratio settings
in the aggregate core/ram/disk filters are not honored because
of placement being used by the FilterScheduler.

While there is related work going on around this in
blueprint initial-allocation-ratios and
blueprint placement-aggregate-allocation-ratios, it is still
a limitation in the current code base and needs to be called
out in the docs.

Change-Id: Ifaf596a8572637f843f47daf5adce394b0365676
Related-Bug: #1804125
(cherry picked from commit d65c18a0a9f02e6d37f2b87ff61f1740c8bfc867)

commit_message:
DRY up SchedulerReportClient init

The _provider_tree and _association_refresh_time
variables were being initialized and then overwritten
in _create_client, so rather than do that, this change
just makes _create_client call clear_provider_cache
to do the same thing. A flag is passed to clear_provider_cache
to avoid logging something useful on construction of the
class instance.

Change-Id: Ib342fa48351cd86b34434e07e81e1f3818ec109d

(1 comment)

I hope we do not attempt to recover from this by reintroducing lazy load."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-12-06 21:34:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

[Later] Oh, I see we're (almost, sort of) doing that.

What happened to the singleton idea? E.g. make SchedulerReportClient itself private and introduce a public get_report_client method that inits-if-necessary and returns a public singleton instance?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-12-07 13:14:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I think the source of the issue is that there is a lock (unnecessary) being held on constructing the SchedulerReportClient object at all. Can we discuss why this lock exists and whether we can just remove it? There is nothing being constructed (state-wise) in the SchedulerReportClient's constructor:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/152cdd639654de56bf8bf605f89b1f5da33fb0ba/nova/scheduler/client/report.py#L257-L292

Have we tried just removing @utils.synchronized(PLACEMENT_CLIENT_SEMAPHORE) from the _create_client() method?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 15:56:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> What happened to the singleton idea? E.g. make SchedulerReportClient itself private and introduce a public get_report_client method that inits-if-necessary and returns a public singleton instance?

I haven't dug into that since I'm kind of going for minimal change here since I don't know if there will be issues with the provider tree cache in the report client, as noted in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 16:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 16:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Looking at test results, this does do the trick:

http://logs.openstack.org/46/623246/2/check/tempest-full/1dfbcf6/controller/logs/screen-n-api.txt.gz

Lock "placement_client" acquired by "nova.scheduler.client.report._create_client"

is only called 3 times (for services, aggregates and local delete scenarios).'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 16:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-07 16:23:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Given the original reason behind adding the lock to SchedulerReportClient is dubious and the aggregate API code doesn't rely on the cache, I'll go ahead and make the following changes:

1. drop the lock

2. make scheduler report client a singleton - but I'm not sure if efried meant a global singleton for *all* users or only the stuff in the API...because I'm assuming the former as it doesn't rely on the cache, but things like compute do rely on the cache."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-12-09 16:43:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 2. make scheduler report client a singleton - but I'm not sure if efried meant a global singleton for *all* users or only the stuff in the API...because I'm assuming the former as it doesn't rely on the cache, but things like compute do rely on the cache.

There's no reason *not* to make it a global singleton. If we try to pick and choose based on who is or is not hitting the cache today, we'll just break something tomorrow when one of the not-cache-users becomes a cache user.

That said, we might also wish to consider scrutinizing the synchronization of cache-accessing methods..."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:39:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I would prefer to keep this as simple as possible for the task at hand, which is reducing the amount of SchedulerReportClient objects we create on nova-api startup since we have a copy per extensions per worker, which gets to be a lot. I think I might just leave what I have in here along with a TODO to consider making SchedulerReportClient a global singleton (per process I guess), and then address Jay's comment by also removing the locking on SchedulerReportClient init. Then the global singleton thing could be done separately when someone wants to take the time to inspect all places where a lock should be added."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-11 22:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-12-11 23:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So I'm going to split the lock removal out and put it at the end of the series."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-12 17:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-12 17:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-06 16:32:52.000000000', 'message': 'Only construct SchedulerReportClient on first access from API

With commit 5d1a50018510b2b281ad33895ae2d9555f5d5b05 each
API/AggregateAPI class instance constructs a SchedulerReportClient
which holds an in-memory lock during its initialization.

With at least 34 API extensions constructing at least
one of those two API classes, the accumulated affect of the
SchedulerReportClient construction can slow down nova-api startup
times, especially when running with multiple API workers, like
in our tempest-full CI job (there are 2 workers, so 68 inits).

This change simply defers constructing the SchedulerReportClient
until it is used, which is only in a few spots in the API code,
which should help with nova-api start times.

Long-term we could consider making it a singleton in nova.compute.api
if that is safe (the aggregate code might be relying on some caching
aspects in the SchedulerReportClient).

'}, {'created': '2018-12-11 22:10:31.000000000', 'message': 'Lazy-load SchedulerReportClient from API and drop _create_client lock

API/AggregateAPI class instance constructs a SchedulerReportClient
which holds an in-memory lock during its initialization.

With at least 34 API extensions constructing at least
one of those two API classes, the accumulated affect of the
SchedulerReportClient construction can slow down nova-api startup
times, especially when running with multiple API workers, like
in our tempest-full CI job (there are 2 workers, so 68 inits).

This change simply defers constructing the SchedulerReportClient
until it is used, which is only in a few spots in the API code,
which should help with nova-api start times.

The lock on SchedulerReportClient._create_client is also removed
since there is no clear indication that it is necessary. It was
added in change I02ac615dc26a4a0d1fd28a638f622777e41d14e4 as a
precaution:

  "I've made the _client method synchronized so that in the unlikely event
   that the resource tracker is trying to do its update job while some
   other thing is happening, we won't waste the client. This may not be
   necessary, but probably doesn't harm anything."

The AggregateAPI also has to construct the SchedulerQueryClient
separately because SchedulerClient creates both the query and
report clients.

Long-term we could consider making SchedulerReportClient a global
singleton so a TODO is left for that since it would require inspecting
cache-sensitive methods to see if a lock is necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1807219

commit_message:
Only construct SchedulerReportClient on first access from API

With commit 5d1a50018510b2b281ad33895ae2d9555f5d5b05 each
API/AggregateAPI class instance constructs a SchedulerReportClient
which holds an in-memory lock during its initialization.

With at least 34 API extensions constructing at least
one of those two API classes, the accumulated affect of the
SchedulerReportClient construction can slow down nova-api startup
times, especially when running with multiple API workers, like
in our tempest-full CI job (there are 2 workers, so 68 inits).

This change simply defers constructing the SchedulerReportClient
until it is used, which is only in a few spots in the API code,
which should help with nova-api start times.

The AggregateAPI also has to construct the SchedulerQueryClient
separately because SchedulerClient creates both the query and
report clients.

Long-term we could consider making it a singleton in nova.compute.api
if that is safe (the aggregate code might be relying on some caching
aspects in the SchedulerReportClient).

Change-Id: Idf6e548d725db0181629a451f46b6a3a5850d186
Closes-Bug: #1807219

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-19 10:02:43.000000000', 'message': 'Check if agent can reach neutron server

If message queue is down or no neutron server is alive,
the L2 traffic will be break during agent restart. Because
the ovs agent will install some basic drop flows first for
the physic bridge mappings. Then during the init procedure,
if message queue is not connected, or neutron-servers are
all down, real traffic flows will not be installed anymore,
this will cause the data plane down if tenant network and
provider network are sharing the physical NICs.

This patch adds a RPC check during init L2 agent when restart,
if the MQ is OK and we have available neutron-server, then
go next step. Otherwise, a MQ timeout will be raised. L2 agent
will start fail, the original flows will not be clean or physical
bridge mapping drop flow will not be installed. The original
installed traffic can still work properly.

Closes-Bug: #1803919
Change-Id: Ie15cf625b3710eaf290d6aafecb3f65df664b9df
'}, {'created': '2018-11-20 10:18:29.000000000', 'message': 'Check if agent can reach neutron server

the ovs-agent, if the MQ is OK and we have available neutron-server,
go next step. Otherwise, a rpc timeout will be raised. L2 agent

installed. The original flows will not be replaced, so the traffic

commit_message:
Check if agent can reach neutron server

The ovs agent will install some basic drop flows first for the
physical bridge mappings during the init procedure. If message
queue is not connected, or neutron-servers are all down, real
traffic flows will not be refreshed anymore. This will cause
the data plane down if tenant network and provider network are
sharing the physical NICs.

This patch adds a RPC check during init L2 agent. When restart
the ovs-agent, if the MQ is OK and we have available neutron-server,
go next step. Otherwise, a rpc timeout will be raised. L2 agent
will start fail, physical bridge mapping drop flows will not be
installed. The original flows will not be replaced, so the traffic
can still work properly.

Closes-Bug: #1803919
Change-Id: Ie15cf625b3710eaf290d6aafecb3f65df664b9df

commit_message:
Make sure nova-compute is not configured with database access

Apparently we're inheriting some database config from the main file,
which should not be set for nova-compute. If we're properly in superconductor
mode where we have a dedicated config for compute, remove those lines
if present.

Closes-Bug: #1797413

Change-Id: I4820abe57a023050dd8d067c77e26028801ff288

Any ideas for how failed health-checks would make containers restarted?'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2018-11-30 10:17:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I like the idea, thank you!
 > Any ideas for how failed health-checks would make containers
 > restarted?

We don't have this functionality and won't be implementing it now IIUC."}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-11-30 16:53:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > I like the idea, thank you!
 > > Any ideas for how failed health-checks would make containers
 > > restarted?
 > 
 > We don't have this functionality and won't be implementing it now
 > IIUC.

This, but also future looking we should be able to add something that looks like: OnFailure=$service.service
to the healthcheck unit. We just need to think about any possible ramifications, if we can limit that to X restart attempts before giving up via OnFailure (I'm not sure), whether it needs to be handled different for service Y than service Z, if we need to make other dependencies in those units, etc before adding new functions."}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-11-30 23:50:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-12-04 17:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

yes, looks good now! let's see how it works"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-07 13:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

Some last comment inline after some testing.
Also I suspect some ordering issue, seen in the logs:

Dec 06 23:08:10 undercloud.localdomain podman[90638]: cannot exec into container that is not running
Dec 06 23:08:10 undercloud.localdomain systemd[1]: nova_compute-healthcheck.service: main process exited, code=exited, status=125/n/a

http://logs.openstack.org/72/620372/7/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers/9e2a2e0/logs/undercloud/var/log/journal.txt.gz#_Dec_06_23_08_10'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-12-07 17:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-12-11 18:38:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

wrt the log errors, it looks to be transient.  Sometimes the mysql socket in the container might take longer than the OnUnitActiveSec for the healthcheck to become responsive - later healthchecks in that log are successful.  Sending a notify from the service unit to the healthcheck unit should help here, however we'll need https://github.com/giuseppe/libpod/commit/dbdc4e46.  For now we can increase the OnUnitActiveSec and implement notify when libpod has it."}, {'account_id': 20868, 'date': '2018-12-11 18:49:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2018-12-13 20:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-12-13 20:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-12-13 20:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Add ability to override meters.yaml and event_definitions.yaml

This change will allow deployer to override meters.yaml and
event_definitions.yaml files, if he would like to change layout/data,
which will be stored in gnocchi, and the way it will be
updated/stored.

Change-Id: I6bfe03dc1f5ad795d91534b1a51c4d8889bb3ed1

commit_message:
gnocchi_resources override fixed

gnocchi_resources.yaml has been defined in main.yml, had all required
variables, but user overrides were not actually deployed on containers
Also, it had an absolete path in GIT repo.

Change-Id: Id32789b59f913cfbb78c1cb4a73b18df85c36655

subject: Stop Logging Amphora Cert
messages: [{'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-12-13 17:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-12-13 17:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-12-13 17:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-12-13 21:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 17:21:04.000000000', 'message': "Stop Logging Amphora Cert

Stop logging amphora cert for tasks:

octavia-failover-amphora-flow- \
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-generate-serverpem

And:
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-update-cert-expiration

This patch adds more exclusions to taskflow DynamicLoggingListener,
which logs task results when running in debug mode.

Failing Over a loadbalancer (SINGLE):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/C0ghBQCXBv6YXqR4YRUY/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/S4bezDTre4KU4oeQDrsF/

Failing Over a loadbalancer (ACTIVE_STANDBY):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/u9aQGvE64evYuYbcWvF4/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/BlJEqGYpHaZYu3LBww3g/

While writing this patch, I also tested for:
1. loadbalancer create with SINGLE topology.
2. loadbalancer create with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.
3. loadbalancer amphora failover with SINGLE topology.
4. loadbalancer amphora failover with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.

I didn't notice any cert prints for those cases.

I was not able to trigger the above-mentioned
octavia-update-cert-expiration, but we have a clear indication for
it in a log screenshot that I attached to the StoryBoard.

Story: 2004606
Task: 28503

Change-Id: I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864

commit_message:
Stop Logging Amphora Cert

Stop logging amphora cert for tasks:

octavia-failover-amphora-flow- \
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-generate-serverpem

And:
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-update-cert-expiration

This patch adds more exclusions to taskflow DynamicLoggingListener,
which logs task results when running in debug mode.

Failing Over a loadbalancer (SINGLE):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/C0ghBQCXBv6YXqR4YRUY/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/S4bezDTre4KU4oeQDrsF/

Failing Over a loadbalancer (ACTIVE_STANDBY):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/u9aQGvE64evYuYbcWvF4/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/BlJEqGYpHaZYu3LBww3g/

While writing this patch, I also tested for:
1. loadbalancer create with SINGLE topology.
2. loadbalancer create with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.
3. loadbalancer amphora failover with SINGLE topology.
4. loadbalancer amphora failover with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.

I didn't notice any cert prints for those cases.

I was not able to trigger the above-mentioned
octavia-update-cert-expiration, but we have a clear indication for
it in a log screenshot that I attached to the StoryBoard.

Story: 2004606
Task: 28503

Change-Id: I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864
(cherry picked from commit 7e8ece9474d0fec92c216ab26e5b143c68479f29)
(cherry picked from commit ec4c88e23ebeb786491158682f9a7dd42928f97a)
(cherry picked from commit 2bd9b68dd1a77723f0d62ac170172333a356aace)
(cherry picked from commit b3a25ee45ff780a0d5338f208def51f4a75c008c)

commit_message:
Tune up documentation to be more useful

The cookiecutter template includes more documentation than we
need, so remove lots of extraneous stuff and lay in the basics.

Change-Id: I6ed22f70153b00844e8de05d186ecc780debc48c

commit_message:
base-test: Check that regional mirror is online

It is possible for our regional mirror to be offline, for some random
reason. If so, fail the job in pre, so zuul will retry the job
(hopefully in a different region).

Change-Id: I9bd9e551930e5fb88bf9bb3156c59568cee3fa89
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add publish-to-pypi as os-resource-classes job

Other jobs are managed locally in the repo, but publish-to-pypi is
expected to be centralized. The library is nearly ready for a
release, so this job is now required.

Change-Id: I9c3aef8148c11cff040d41c59eb8eb4d398e6517

subject: remove the tag pipeline entry for release-notes-jobs
messages: [{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-01 12:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-11-01 13:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-01 13:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nmmh, should we keep releasenotes template in project-config?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-11-01 16:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-12-13 22:09:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-01 12:52:37.000000000', 'message': 'remove the tag pipeline entry for release-notes-jobs

We want projects to be using release-notes-jobs-python3, but most
still have release-notes-jobs configured in their stable
branches. Because tags are not branch aware, this means that we end up
running two versions of the release notes publishing job when we tag
releases. Those two jobs race, and at least one usually fails.

By removing the tag pipeline entry from the older project template we
avoid running two jobs for tag events, while continuing to use the
older job when patches merge into older branches.

See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-November/136214.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I34266e5629b1eac48c0defd64b03bba4a61eaf02
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove the tag pipeline entry for release-notes-jobs

We want projects to be using release-notes-jobs-python3, but most
still have release-notes-jobs configured in their stable
branches. Because tags are not branch aware, this means that we end up
running two versions of the release notes publishing job when we tag
releases. Those two jobs race, and at least one usually fails.

By removing the tag pipeline entry from the older project template we
avoid running two jobs for tag events, while continuing to use the
older job when patches merge into older branches.

See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-November/136214.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I34266e5629b1eac48c0defd64b03bba4a61eaf02
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add nodeset ubuntu-bionic-2-node for bionic multinode testing

Given that Bionic is the Ubuntu LTS release standard for the Stein
cycle, there should be a 2-node nodeset for it.  This will enable
multinode grenade testing on python3 to be done correctly.

Change-Id: I4a756f1f284a6967853da2dc34e477b2ba7b2340
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/622612

commit_message:
use opensuse15 as generic name instead of opensuse150

The Leap 15.x releases should be compatible with each
other so we don't need to track the minor release.
Lets standardize on opensuse15 so that we can more easily
switch to Leap 15.1 once it becomes available.

Change-Id: Ie2ea1156f905339a48fb19f68b4eb25dd4ff2dea

subject: Fix flavor keyerror when nova boot vm
messages:
[{'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-07-12 11:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-07-12 15:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This looks good to me, but because it's fixing a bug, there needs to be at least one unit test added that shows that it does.  I also had difficulty understanding the commit message; you might try rephrasing it like so:

    If the returned data from "nova boot" does not have a "flavor"
    attribute, a KeyError is raised.  This change fixes the problem.'}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-07-13 06:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-07-13 14:01:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't think this addresses the testing I want to see.  All of the fakes have 'flavor' keys, so the added test doesn't test the case where 'flavor' is missing from the response."}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-07-16 05:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-07-16 09:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-07-16 11:18:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-07-16 13:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

thanks'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-07-17 06:34:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

In '_print_server' function,
when accessing an attribute of the server resource object [1],
the 'get' method of the server resource object is called (GET /servers/{server_id} is called).
It always sets 'flavor' in the server resource object.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/32a3244bb4879f5c0ea430de6fac284b2a987441/novaclient/v2/shell.py#L2296
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/32a3244bb4879f5c0ea430de6fac284b2a987441/novaclient/base.py#L177

But the 'get' method of the server resource object is failed though creating the server is successful,
the issue in the bug report occurs.

IMO, it is better to fix as follows.

1. Add a check whether 'get' call [2] is successful or not.
2. If the call is failed (e.g. 404 NotFound), raise an exception.
3. Handle the exception in 'do_boot' method. [3]

[3] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/32a3244bb4879f5c0ea430de6fac284b2a987441/novaclient/v2/shell.py#L912"}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-07-17 06:35:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

the 'get' method of the server resource object is called (GET /servers/{server_id} is called). --> See [2]"}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-07-17 07:23:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Takashi NATSUME

-->IMO, it is better to fix as follows.
-->1. Add a check whether 'get' call [2] is successful or not.
I don't know how to check whether 'get' call successful or not in novaclient/base.py#L177, could you give an example?

-->2. If the call is failed (e.g. 404 NotFound), raise an exception.
the same with 1

-->3. Handle the exception in 'do_boot' method. [3]
Is it right like this in novaclient/v2/shell.py#L912 ?
    try:
        _print_server(cs, args, server)
    except exception as e:
        print('Error: %s' % e)"}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-07-18 05:55:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

When accessing 'address' field of the server object [1], the issue occurs (404 NotFound is returned in GET request).
It raises an exception (NotFound exception), but it is squashed at [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/32a3244bb4879f5c0ea430de6fac284b2a987441/novaclient/v2/servers.py#L405
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/32a3244bb4879f5c0ea430de6fac284b2a987441/novaclient/v2/servers.py#L408

So remove try-catch clause in the 'networks' method and enable it to raise the exception to outside of the method.
Then catch it and raise the CommandError exception [3] in the 'do_boot' method.

[3] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/32a3244bb4879f5c0ea430de6fac284b2a987441/novaclient/v2/shell.py#L2428-L2431"}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-07-18 07:09:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for your reply, bug I can not get your point. 
Could you show the code in novaclient/base.py#L177 ? 
-->Add a check whether 'get' call [2] is successful or not.
you mean like this:

    def __getattr__(self, k):
        if k not in self.__dict__:
            # NOTE(bcwaldon): disallow lazy-loading if already loaded once
            if not self.is_loaded():
                try:
                    self.get()
                except:
                    raise CommandError
                return self.__getattr__(k)

            raise AttributeError(k)
        else:
            return self.__dict__[k]

Is this right ?
I am puzzle with this."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-07-18 07:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> -->Add a check whether 'get' call [2] is successful or not.

Sorry. It is not necessary.
The following code *may* work well.

diff --git a/novaclient/v2/servers.py b/novaclient/v2/servers.py
index d872fa0..8de0b19 100644
--- a/novaclient/v2/servers.py
+++ b/novaclient/v2/servers.py
@@ -405,7 +405,7 @@ class Server(base.Resource):
             for network_label, address_list in self.addresses.items():
                 networks[network_label] = [a['addr'] for a in address_list]
             return networks
-        except Exception:
+        except AttributeError as e:
             return {}
 
     @api_versions.wraps("2.0", "2.24")
diff --git a/novaclient/v2/shell.py b/novaclient/v2/shell.py
index 99cc2f5..4e3019c 100644
--- a/novaclient/v2/shell.py
+++ b/novaclient/v2/shell.py
@@ -909,7 +909,10 @@ def do_boot(cs, args):
         utils.print_dict(new_server)
         return
     else:
-        _print_server(cs, args, server)
+        try:
+            _print_server(cs, args, server)
+        except Exception as e:
+            raise exceptions.CommandError(six.text_type(e))
 
     if args.poll:
         _poll_for_status(cs.servers.get, server.id, 'building', ['active'])'}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-07-18 08:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thank you for showing the code.

According to your code, and I follow the nova command like this:

first command:
nova --debug boot vm001 --flavor flavor-id --image image-id --nic net-id=network-id
It's result is like this:
RESP BODY: {"itemNotFound": {"message": "Instance 0a3a4718-c4d4-493a-8b1b-987b66fe9da8 could not be found.", "code": 404}}
ERROR (CommandError): Instance 0a3a4718-c4d4-493a-8b1b-987b66fe9da8 could not be found. (HTTP 404) (Request-ID: req-2897fec3-bce7-4905-9859-e9caf3b97983)

Actually there is only a KeyError with no flavor attribute in return data, 
and it has nothing to do with the network attribute (Although there is no network attribute in return data too).
So I think the code in novaclient/v2/servers.py#405 may not to change.

second command:
nova list
The vm001 is in the return data and it's status is active, it means that the vm is successful to boot.
So I think the code in novaclient/v2/shell.py#909 with do_boot function may not to change.
It only should change the code in _print_server function like this:
info.pop('flavor', None)

Could you agree with me or other advice?'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-02 23:04:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I agree with Takashi that this isn't fixing the root cause of the bug. The bug is occurring because the code is trying to process a returned server response, when one was not received at all because of the 404 error. If the server is not found, we should not try to parse the server response and instead we should return the error to the user."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-10-26 14:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@zhaolihui, are you still working on this patch? May I take it over?'}, {'account_id': 20223, 'date': '2018-10-29 01:45:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Takashi NATSUME  yes, as your will'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-10-31 05:46:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@zhaolihui, Thank you for your reply.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-11-01 10:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-11-01 13:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-11-14 13:30:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-12-03 05:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-12-13 07:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-12-13 20:27:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(2 comments)

Sorry for the delay in reviewing this. I had a difficult time understanding what all was going on here.

Now that I understand, I think this is the most sensible way to fix this problem, LGTM. Thanks Takashi.'}]

When creating a server (the 'nova boot' command),
it calls 'POST /servers' API.

The response does not have 'addresses' and 'flavor' attributes.
When accessing 'networks' attribute in the '_print_server' function,
it calls 'GET /servers/{server_id}' and get the 'addresses' and
'flavor' attributes.

If 'GET /servers/{server_id}' fails, the server object does not have
the 'flavor' attribute, then KeyError is raised when accessing it.

Fix the issue by making it raise a CommandError
when the 'GET /servers/{server_id}' fails.

commit_message:
Fix flavor keyerror when nova boot vm

When creating a server (the 'nova boot' command),
it calls 'POST /servers' API.

The response does not have 'addresses' and 'flavor' attributes.
When accessing 'networks' attribute in the '_print_server' function,
it calls 'GET /servers/{server_id}' and get the 'addresses' and
'flavor' attributes.

If 'GET /servers/{server_id}' fails, the server object does not have
the 'flavor' attribute, then KeyError is raised when accessing it.

Fix the issue by making it raise a CommandError
when the 'GET /servers/{server_id}' fails.

Co-Authored-By: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I3ef096c61b0e05a637ab0c4a1027338fa87e4f09
Closes-Bug: #1781368

commit_message:
Adding the netlify-sandbox project

We are setting up the netlify-sandbox project in order to create and
test the implementation of a gerrit plugin to netlify CMS such that
changes can be submitted to gerrit for review before going live on a
netlify CMS powered website.

Change-Id: Ib1561a243341995b720473566ab62a57c073128f

commit_message:
Change os-resource-classes and os-traits acl config to placement

During the initial creation of the os-resource-classes repo it
was put under nova.config. This was probably not the right choice
but was done to be aligned with os-traits, which is a very
similar library.

Instead of keeping os-resource-classes in the past for the sake of
os-traits, let's move them both to the future, and include
osc-placement, the openstack client plugin for placement, as well.

The placement.config is a superset of the nova.config. If/when
placement is its own project team, os-resource-classes, os-traits,
and osc-placement will be members of the deliverables.

Change-Id: Ice1b0476bfb7471ddab836df44dd26eaba8ccd19

messages:
[{'account_id': 27299, 'date': '2018-12-07 04:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-07 04:30:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-12-07 12:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add new project called ku.stella

Stella is Kore Univ. project to provide performance SLA for cloud infra
software. KU.Stella is an OpenStack component to support Stella.
(This project is an unofficial OpenStack project)

For more information visit http://stella.korea.ac.kr

Change-Id: Iee4c189b9582a654dfec03fa29b25afe60ae6107

There was also discussion about adding tempest-slow but that job is
already defined in the grafana config.

commit_message:
Neutron grafana update for co-gating section

The networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release job needed to be added to
the neutron grafana dashboard, as part of a new initiative to allow
stadium projects to add a non-voting job to make sure there is not
breakage as neutron master changes.  Since ironic already has a job
doing this, consolidate them into a new section for co-gating jobs.

Also add the tempest-slow job to the gating jobs, as specified in the
change upon which this depends.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/622419
Change-Id: I20605bef23218a06d04b188a5829967a2a7d8e5c

We document that this can be disabled by setting the
instance_master_path config  to "<None>",
but don't actually support it in code. oslo.config doesn't actually
translate that value to the Python None as we expect.

Allow disabling the cache by setting the config to the empty string, as
in "instance_master_path=". This doesn't make sense as a directory to
use as a cache anyway, so it shouldn't break anyone.

commit_message:
Allow disabling instance image cache

We document that this can be disabled by setting the
instance_master_path config  to "<None>",
but don't actually support it in code. oslo.config doesn't actually
translate that value to the Python None as we expect.

Allow disabling the cache by setting the config to the empty string, as
in "instance_master_path=". This doesn't make sense as a directory to
use as a cache anyway, so it shouldn't break anyone.

Change-Id: I1bb62d55e3e18272fd5da355d63fd2c11a033acd
Story: 2004279
Task: 27829

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 22:06:36.000000000', 'message': 'WIP/DNM: Add TunedCustomProfile parameter

Add TunedCustomProfile parameter containing a map describing
a custom tuned profile like the following:

tuned_custom_profile:
  name: my_custom_profile
  sections:
    - name: main
      params:
        - option: summary
          value: ceph-osd Filestore tuned profile
        - option: include
          value: throughput-performance
    - name: sysctl
      params:
        - option: vm.dirty_ratio
          value: 10
        - option: vm.dirty_background_ratio
          value: 3
    - name: sysfs
      params:
        - option: /sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run
          value: 0

Which would produce /usr/lib/tuned/my_custom_profile/tuned.conf containing:

[main]
summary=ceph-osd Filestore tuned profile
include=throughput-performance
[sysctl]
vm.dirty_ratio = 10
vm.dirty_background_ratio = 3
[sysfs]
/sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run=0

Depends-On: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Change-Id: Iaa1c82cefac5c8f2959fd7aeb57bd6860fd9096a
Closes-Bug: #1800232
'}, {'created': '2018-11-28 16:38:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add TunedCustomProfile parameter and HCI Ceph filestore environment

Add TunedCustomProfile parameter which may contain a string in
INI format describing a custom tuned profile. Also provide a new
environment file for users of hypercoverged Ceph deployments
using the Ceph filestore storage backened. The tuned profile is
based on heavy I/O load testing. The provided environment file
creates /usr/lib/tuned/ceph-filestore-osd-hci/tuned.conf whose
content is the following and sets this tuned profile to be active.

[main]
summary=ceph-osd Filestore tuned profile
include=throughput-performance
[sysctl]
vm.dirty_ratio = 10
vm.dirty_background_ratio = 3
[sysfs]
/sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run=0

Depends-On: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Change-Id: Iaa1c82cefac5c8f2959fd7aeb57bd6860fd9096a
Closes-Bug: #1800232

creates /etc/tuned/ceph-filestore-osd-hci/tuned.conf whose
content is the following and sets this tuned profile to be active.

[main]
summary=ceph-osd Filestore tuned profile
include=throughput-performance
[sysctl]
vm.dirty_ratio = 10
vm.dirty_background_ratio = 3
[sysfs]
/sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run=0

Depends-On: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Change-Id: Iaa1c82cefac5c8f2959fd7aeb57bd6860fd9096a
Closes-Bug: #1800232
'}]
commit_message:
Add TunedCustomProfile parameter and HCI Ceph filestore environment

Add TunedCustomProfile parameter which may contain a string in
INI format describing a custom tuned profile. Also provide a new
environment file for users of hypercoverged Ceph deployments
using the Ceph filestore storage backened. The tuned profile is
based on heavy I/O load testing. The provided environment file
creates /etc/tuned/ceph-filestore-osd-hci/tuned.conf whose
content is the following and sets this tuned profile to be active.

[main]
summary=ceph-osd Filestore tuned profile
include=throughput-performance
[sysctl]
vm.dirty_ratio = 10
vm.dirty_background_ratio = 3
[sysfs]
/sys/kernel/mm/ksm/run=0

Depends-On: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Change-Id: Iaa1c82cefac5c8f2959fd7aeb57bd6860fd9096a
Closes-Bug: #1800232

commit_message:
Allow user to define a custom tuned profile

Add custom_profile parameter to tripleo::profile::base::tuned
which may a string in INI format describing a tuned profile
which puppet will then create and apply with the name supplied
by the profile parameter.

Change-Id: Iba17d86bbdd710623ba1ba44b1ea5d4c1b99c541
Related-Bug: #1800232

commit_message:
Add container images configuration wizard

Add wizard to configure container images, introduce form to provide
images configuration and run container_images_prepare_default Mistral
workflow. Default configuration is loaded if ContainerImagePrepare
parameter is not yet populated. User can also reset the configuration
to default

Story: 2004509
Task: 28234
Change-Id: I739eb86e43276a9c27b5136522515c7104b12d86
(cherry picked from commit 3fbbe4670a3f0533cb1c0d2d1c7ac779e56e0d1c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-29 09:51:40.000000000', 'message': "Support ports belonging to Neutron DHCP agents

Before this patch, both the sync tool and the production code
would assume that 'network:dhcp' owner ports would be for
the OVN metadata service. However, since Neutron DHCP agents
can be deployed as well on OVN environments, we need to support
these ports as well.

This change is doing several things:

- Fixing sync tool so that Neutron DHCP ports are not deleted
  anymore (these ports are owned by DHCP and have a device_id
  as 'dhcp<host_uuid>-<network_id>'). Syncing these ports in
  OVN will no longer result in creating 'localport' ports but
  normal ports to allow non-local DHCP traffic.
- Fixing networking-ovn code to skip such ports when looking
  for the metadata port on a specific network.
- Newly created metadata ports will have a device_id such as
  'ovnmeta-<network_id>'.

Change-Id: I30181e1752f456f30f94818c5350f447c387cbb2
Related-Bug: #1804390
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry-picked from d28495fe42ea9a940260e951b32e0a814c75ce70)
"}]
commit_message:
Support ports belonging to Neutron DHCP agents

Before this patch, both the sync tool and the production code
would assume that 'network:dhcp' owner ports would be for
the OVN metadata service. However, since Neutron DHCP agents
can be deployed as well on OVN environments, we need to support
these ports as well.

This change is doing several things:

- Fixing sync tool so that Neutron DHCP ports are not deleted
  anymore (these ports are owned by DHCP and have a device_id
  as 'dhcp<host_uuid>-<network_id>'). Syncing these ports in
  OVN will no longer result in creating 'localport' ports but
  normal ports to allow non-local DHCP traffic.
- Fixing networking-ovn code to skip such ports when looking
  for the metadata port on a specific network.
- Newly created metadata ports will have a device_id such as
  'ovnmeta-<network_id>'.

Change-Id: I30181e1752f456f30f94818c5350f447c387cbb2
Related-Bug: #1804390
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry-picked from d28495fe42ea9a940260e951b32e0a814c75ce70)

 Make sure this host can be reached over ssh", "unreachable": true}']

(cherry picked from commit 6ea964245d4e31a04c5c84065d564646d60e8f79)
'}]
commit_message:
Drop overcloud-user for ceph external-upgrade.

Having overcloud-user specified breaks ceph upgrade on a
pre-provisioned servers:
UNREACHABLE! => {"changed": false, "msg": "SSH Error: data could not be sent to remote host \\"192.168.24.138\\".
 Make sure this host can be reached over ssh", "unreachable": true}']

Change-Id: Id5a3f6d8461d31e95680df491c97cd2ef2bd0c15

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-12 11:30:45.000000000', 'message': 'Harden placement init under wsgi

- This change tries to address an edge case discovered
  when running placement under mod_wsgi where
  if the placement wsgi application is re-initialize the db_api
  configure method attempts to reconfigure a started transaction
  factory.

- This since oslo.db transaction factories do not support
  reconfiguration at runtime this result in an exception being
  raised preventing reloading of the Placement API without
  restarting apache to force mod_wsgi to recreate the
  python interpreter.

- This change introduces a run once decorator to allow annotating
  functions that should only be executed once for the lifetime fo
  an interpreter.

- This change applies the run_once decorator to the db_api configure
  method, to suppress the attempt to reconfigure the current
  TransactionFactory on application reload.

NOTE(lyarwood): Simple positional conflict due to
Ie7bf5d012e2ccbcd63c262ddaf739782afcdaf56 and
I81d13418d75b46fbdb9f6d44889a207528c8d6de not being present in
stable/rocky.

Conflicts:
        nova/utils.py

Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@ericsson.com>
Closes-Bug: #1799246
Related-Bug: #1784155
Change-Id: I704196711d30c1124e713ac31111a8ea6fa2f1ba
(cherry picked from commit 00d08a3288f61268f8a823991fadf0d83c36c04d)
'}]
commit_message:
Harden placement init under wsgi

- This change tries to address an edge case discovered
  when running placement under mod_wsgi where
  if the placement wsgi application is re-initialize the db_api
  configure method attempts to reconfigure a started transaction
  factory.

- This since oslo.db transaction factories do not support
  reconfiguration at runtime this result in an exception being
  raised preventing reloading of the Placement API without
  restarting apache to force mod_wsgi to recreate the
  python interpreter.

- This change introduces a run once decorator to allow annotating
  functions that should only be executed once for the lifetime fo
  an interpreter.

- This change applies the run_once decorator to the db_api configure
  method, to suppress the attempt to reconfigure the current
  TransactionFactory on application reload.

NOTE(lyarwood): Simple positional conflict due to
Ie7bf5d012e2ccbcd63c262ddaf739782afcdaf56 and
I81d13418d75b46fbdb9f6d44889a207528c8d6de not being present in
stable/rocky.

Conflicts:
        nova/utils.py

Co-Authored-By: Balazs Gibizer <balazs.gibizer@ericsson.com>
Closes-Bug: #1799246
Related-Bug: #1784155
Change-Id: I704196711d30c1124e713ac31111a8ea6fa2f1ba
(cherry picked from commit 00d08a3288f61268f8a823991fadf0d83c36c04d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 10:54:34.000000000', 'message': "Stop Logging Amphora Cert

Stop logging amphora cert for task: octavia-failover-amphora-flow

This patch adds more exclusions to taskflow DynamicLoggingListener, which logs
task results when running in debug mode.

Failing Over a loadbalancer (SINGLE):

Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/C0ghBQCXBv6YXqR4YRUY/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/S4bezDTre4KU4oeQDrsF/

Failing Over a loadbalancer (ACTIVE_STANDBY):

Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/u9aQGvE64evYuYbcWvF4/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/BlJEqGYpHaZYu3LBww3g/

While writing this patch, I also tested for:
1. loadbalancer create with SINGLE topology.
2. loadbalancer create with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.
3. loadbalancer amphora failover with SINGLE topology.
4. loadbalancer amphora failover with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.

I didn't notice any cert prints for those cases.

Change-Id: I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864

"}, {'created': '2018-12-13 14:28:28.000000000', 'message': "Stop Logging Amphora Cert

Stop logging amphora cert for tasks:

octavia-failover-amphora-flow- \
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-generate-serverpem

And:
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-update-cert-expiration

This patch adds more exclusions to taskflow DynamicLoggingListener,
which logs task results when running in debug mode.

Failing Over a loadbalancer (SINGLE):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/C0ghBQCXBv6YXqR4YRUY/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/S4bezDTre4KU4oeQDrsF/

Failing Over a loadbalancer (ACTIVE_STANDBY):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/u9aQGvE64evYuYbcWvF4/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/BlJEqGYpHaZYu3LBww3g/

While writing this patch, I also tested for:
1. loadbalancer create with SINGLE topology.
2. loadbalancer create with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.
3. loadbalancer amphora failover with SINGLE topology.
4. loadbalancer amphora failover with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.

I didn't notice any cert prints for those cases.

I was not able to trigger the above-mentioned
octavia-update-cert-expiration, but we have a clear indication for
it in a log screenshot that I attached to the StoryBoard.

Story: 2004606
Task: 28503

Change-Id: I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864

While writing this patch, I also tested for:
1. loadbalancer create with SINGLE topology.
2. loadbalancer create with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.
3. loadbalancer amphora failover with SINGLE topology.
4. loadbalancer amphora failover with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.

I didn't notice any cert prints for those cases.

I was not able to trigger the above-mentioned
octavia-update-cert-expiration, but we have a clear indication for
it in a log screenshot that I attached to the StoryBoard.

Story: 2004606

commit_message:
Stop Logging Amphora Cert

Stop logging amphora cert for tasks:

octavia-failover-amphora-flow- \
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-generate-serverpem

And:
octavia-create-amp-for-lb-subflow-octavia-update-cert-expiration

This patch adds more exclusions to taskflow DynamicLoggingListener,
which logs task results when running in debug mode.

Failing Over a loadbalancer (SINGLE):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/C0ghBQCXBv6YXqR4YRUY/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/S4bezDTre4KU4oeQDrsF/

Failing Over a loadbalancer (ACTIVE_STANDBY):
Before: http://paste.openstack.org/show/u9aQGvE64evYuYbcWvF4/
After:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/BlJEqGYpHaZYu3LBww3g/

While writing this patch, I also tested for:
1. loadbalancer create with SINGLE topology.
2. loadbalancer create with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.
3. loadbalancer amphora failover with SINGLE topology.
4. loadbalancer amphora failover with ACTIVE_STANDBY topology.

I didn't notice any cert prints for those cases.

I was not able to trigger the above-mentioned
octavia-update-cert-expiration, but we have a clear indication for
it in a log screenshot that I attached to the StoryBoard.

Story: 2004606
Task: 28503

Change-Id: I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-06 16:08:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix NFS "already mounted" detection

Previous fix

2f32c98a RemoteFS: don't fail in do_mount if already mounted

was made with the assumption that "already mounted" appearing
in stderr from an NFS mount means that the NFS share was already
mounted.

However, the NFS client can fail with "busy or already mounted"
in cases where it fails to mount the share as well.

This results in the Cinder NFS backup driver believing that the
NFS mount has succeeded when it didn't, and as a result, data
can be written to the local disk instead of the NFS target.

Fail if the share isn't actually mounted rather than succeeding.

Related-Bug: #1780813
Closes-Bug: #1797233
Change-Id: Iebd1afb3340fcaeb1969784966c4f9be35a28417
(cherry picked from commit 360a20c7c7b4c385255200a574edc0ca1ac8d87c)
(cherry picked from commit 4c94477cb525b25f178d52ff1b01bfe1fc3d3dd3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix NFS "already mounted" detection

Previous fix

2f32c98a RemoteFS: don't fail in do_mount if already mounted

was made with the assumption that "already mounted" appearing
in stderr from an NFS mount means that the NFS share was already
mounted.

However, the NFS client can fail with "busy or already mounted"
in cases where it fails to mount the share as well.

This results in the Cinder NFS backup driver believing that the
NFS mount has succeeded when it didn't, and as a result, data
can be written to the local disk instead of the NFS target.

Fail if the share isn't actually mounted rather than succeeding.

Related-Bug: #1780813
Closes-Bug: #1797233
Change-Id: Iebd1afb3340fcaeb1969784966c4f9be35a28417
(cherry picked from commit 360a20c7c7b4c385255200a574edc0ca1ac8d87c)
(cherry picked from commit 4c94477cb525b25f178d52ff1b01bfe1fc3d3dd3)

commit_message:
release os-vif 1.13.1

os-vif 1.13.0 had a resource leak which was adressed by
change I37ee291c22c2c3933ee229bfc939a4481898626c.
This change releases the fix for bug #1807949 and has
no other changes form 1.13.0.

Change-Id: I01b54d5d328e96a3b660bbaaab45d8caee881f01
Related-Bug: #1807949

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-07 14:44:38.000000000', 'message': 'Force all fdb entries update after ovs-vswitchd restart

When ovs-vswitchd process is restarted neutron-ovs-agent will
handle it and reconfigure all ports and openflows in bridges.
Unfortunatelly when tunnel networks are used together with
L2pop mechanism driver, this driver will not notice that agent
lost all openflow config and will not send all fdb entries which
should be added on host.

In such case L2pop mechanism driver should behave in same way like
when neutron-ovs-agent is restarted and send all fdb_entries to
agent.

This patch adds "simulate" of agent start flag when ovs_restart is
handled thus neutron-server will send all fdb_entries to agent and
tunnels openflow rules can be reconfigured properly.

Change-Id: I5f1471e20bbad90c4cdcbc6c06d3a4412db55b2a
Closes-bug: #1804842
(cherry picked from commit ae031d18866a9e3652f4fc122f120915209a7b29)
'}]
commit_message:
Force all fdb entries update after ovs-vswitchd restart

When ovs-vswitchd process is restarted neutron-ovs-agent will
handle it and reconfigure all ports and openflows in bridges.
Unfortunatelly when tunnel networks are used together with
L2pop mechanism driver, this driver will not notice that agent
lost all openflow config and will not send all fdb entries which
should be added on host.

In such case L2pop mechanism driver should behave in same way like
when neutron-ovs-agent is restarted and send all fdb_entries to
agent.

This patch adds "simulate" of agent start flag when ovs_restart is
handled thus neutron-server will send all fdb_entries to agent and
tunnels openflow rules can be reconfigured properly.

Change-Id: I5f1471e20bbad90c4cdcbc6c06d3a4412db55b2a
Closes-bug: #1804842
(cherry picked from commit ae031d18866a9e3652f4fc122f120915209a7b29)

documented in a backlogged specification so that we don't lose the

commit_message:
Use kafka extras for oslo.messaging

oslo.messaging replaced kafka-python to confluent-kafka [1], so instead of
adding the kafka-python to test-requirements the oslo-messaging[kafka]
should be used.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/releasenotes/notes/kafka-client-library-change-fe16d5a34550db7f.yaml#L11

Closes-Bug: #1808350

Change-Id: If56890b35bbe40141c01467e47bccdf4d5584e86

commit_message:
WIP: Make error detectors objects

This allows for more flexible error detection, and could allow us to
support marking errors as being temporary, and therefore possible to
retry.

Change-Id: Idf81e5be81c1dfb8dc01e5b9f11497de5adb6047
Story: 2003148
Task: 24644

Looks good to me. There is another case that this can't handle which is the long lived lock in an ironic conductor while the node is going into cleaning. While the vif will still attempt to be removed, ironic's API will respond with 409s to the request of removing the vif. Should a BMC hang in that entire process of tearing down a node, we could easily exceed the retry/timeout limit for the vif finally being removed. We're working on the ironic side to address that, but this definitely fixes additional possible cases that could be encountered."}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2018-02-07 21:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23312, 'date': '2018-02-08 10:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So a vif being attached basically kills the ironic node, so I think we should have this work around.

I wish we could track down why we loose track of the VIFs, it probably explains the whole "leak IP addresses" and "leak ports" bugs that seem next to impossible to squash.

This might help us track down the issue, as we have a clear log message we can look for, and then track down what went wrong previously (like check for related warn logs, etc).'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-05-03 09:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

The behaviour has recently changed [1] on the ironic side to remove all VIFs upon node teardown. I think that with that in place, this patch is no longer required. What do people think?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/commit/3a4e259a3714cedcad567e229e983f1b559c2668'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-03 17:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think it would be good to still ensure that they are no longer present... out of curiosity, is some of the leaking that has been mentioned when heat is driving nova?  If so, I may have found that issue...'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-05-03 17:38:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> We do often use heat to orchestrate nova, yes. What is the issue
 > you've found?

https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1766763"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-05-03 18:11:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > We do often use heat to orchestrate nova, yes. What is the issue
 > > you've found?
 > 
 > https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1766763

Thanks, that certainly all sounds familiar. Will be good to see it fixed."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-21 07:52:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Workflow

Removing W-1 based on Julia's suggestion that this will still be useful to have."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-28 23:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Meh, pretty hacky workaround for something that sounds like it was already changed on the ironic side.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-28 23:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

I think I could be convinced to go with this if it were generalized a bit.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-13 18:14:09.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'm inclined to abandon this one. As various people have pointed out, it's a bit of a hack and should no longer be required. If we see cases where it would be useful, then there is probably a bug somewhere that needs addressing."}]

commit_message:
Unplug all VIFs from ironic nodes during tear down

In some rare cases nova can lose track of some of an instances VIFs,
preventing them from being detached from the ironic node. This can
cause subsequent deployments to the node to fail with this error:

VirtualInterfacePlugException: Cannot attach VIF
409830a5-b4de-4d1d-be22-5e6fe4ccd65b to the node
3aaaf79e-99fb-42a3-b22e-b1a7fae44272 due to error: Unable to attach VIF
409830a5-b4de-4d1d-be22-5e6fe4ccd65b, not enough free physical ports.

To work around this, when tearing down an instance we now list all VIFs
for the node in ironic after the known instance VIFs have been detached,
and detach those as well.

Change-Id: I70077f5f249ee35bfd4a08a9180172f571b1cb5a
Closes-Bug: #1733861
Related-Bug: #1743652

[{'created': '2018-12-07 16:07:53.000000000', 'message': "docker: wire SELinuxMode with Ansible vars

Instead of hardcoding the SElinux enablement in DockerOptions, let's
automatically enable it when SELinuxMode is set to enforced in the
deployment.

It'll wire container_registry_selinux variable in ansible-role-container-registry
which enables --selinux-enabled if set to True.

commit_message:
docker: wire SELinuxMode with Ansible vars

When SELinuxMode is set to enforced in thedeployment, configure Docker
to enable SElinux.

It'll wire container_registry_selinux variable in ansible-role-container-registry
which enables --selinux-enabled if set to True.

Change-Id: Ic030ecbe8b6719ba45cb7c27c6cf44bab14fed88

[{'account_id': 18236, 'date': '2018-12-10 22:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-10 22:07:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Use fake network interface in tempest VIF attach

The fake network interface provides similar behaviour to the flat and
neutron network interfaces during VIF attachment, but does not interact
with neutron. This allows us to test VIF attachment without requiring
neutron to be available.

Change-Id: Ie0fa436f0e6b3078af2e56f7724083d9df506956
Depends-On: I2dfdbaa32c66b5d18b86d23b4992129dcfeff320

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-01 15:53:57.000000000', 'message': "Reorder active node VIF [un]plugging

When attaching or detaching a VIF to/from an active node, the VIF is
plugged or unplugged immediately in neutron. This action is currently
performed after either saving or clearing the VIF's ID to/from the
ironic port's internal_info field. This means that if plugging or
unplugging the VIF fails for any reason, the VIF will remain attached or
detached, despite the attach/detach API request failing.

This change reorders the plug/unplug and save/clear operations such that
a failure in plugging/unplugging the neutron port will result in the VIF
not being saved to or cleared from the ironic port.

Change-Id: I8c1e8653df0aee17b50e5c484a06ddc1b5ed5096
"}]
commit_message:
Reorder active node VIF [un]plugging

When attaching or detaching a VIF to/from an active node, the VIF is
plugged or unplugged immediately in neutron. This action is currently
performed after either saving or clearing the VIF's ID to/from the
ironic port's internal_info field. This means that if plugging or
unplugging the VIF fails for any reason, the VIF will remain attached or
detached, despite the attach/detach API request failing.

This change reorders the plug/unplug and save/clear operations such that
a failure in plugging/unplugging the neutron port will result in the VIF
not being saved to or cleared from the ironic port.

Change-Id: I8c1e8653df0aee17b50e5c484a06ddc1b5ed5096
