[{'created': '2018-12-11 14:20:43.000000000', 'message': "Make dnsmasq invocation independent of Neutron DHCP code

In general, networking-calico's UT can break as changes are made to the
core Neutron code that some of our classes inherit from.  In particular,
the UT for _build_cmdline_callback recently broke because of this
change:

    0fce3ca2c1641fbcfb8327a86d7225e2c3972263
    Author: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>  2018-10-29 17:08:33
    Committer: Brian Haley <bhaley@redhat.com>  2018-11-28 20:49:25

        Secure dnsmasq process against external abuse

        Currently any dhcp agent instance will work as an open resolver. For
        deployments using publicly routed addresses for tenant networks, this
        allows the agent being abused in dDoS attacks, see [1].

        By setting the `--local-service` option dnsmasq will filter DNS queries
        and reply only to queries from directly attached networks.

        [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206

        Closes-Bug: 1501206
        Change-Id: I76d810aad2ce0f15a88bd798963012fa0efca74e

We may want that change for Calico too; however, independently I'd like
to insulate networking-calico from being quietly broken by further
changes in this area, and we can do that by freezing in a copy of the
last-known-working Neutron code.

Change-Id: Ic9abdc641805455149c65b3f4502c1f4869dc0ec
"}]
commit_message:
Make dnsmasq invocation independent of Neutron DHCP code

In general, networking-calico's UT can break as changes are made to the
core Neutron code that some of our classes inherit from.  In particular,
the UT for _build_cmdline_callback recently broke because of this
change:

    0fce3ca2c1641fbcfb8327a86d7225e2c3972263
    Author: Jens Harbott <j.harbott@x-ion.de>  2018-10-29 17:08:33
    Committer: Brian Haley <bhaley@redhat.com>  2018-11-28 20:49:25

        Secure dnsmasq process against external abuse

        Currently any dhcp agent instance will work as an open resolver. For
        deployments using publicly routed addresses for tenant networks, this
        allows the agent being abused in dDoS attacks, see [1].

        By setting the `--local-service` option dnsmasq will filter DNS queries
        and reply only to queries from directly attached networks.

        [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206

        Closes-Bug: 1501206
        Change-Id: I76d810aad2ce0f15a88bd798963012fa0efca74e

We may want that change for Calico too; however, independently I'd like
to insulate networking-calico from being quietly broken by further
changes in this area, and we can do that by freezing in a copy of the
last-known-working Neutron code.

Change-Id: Ic9abdc641805455149c65b3f4502c1f4869dc0ec

commit_message:
Sample templates for linux_bond, ovs_bond, dpdkbond using VFs

1. Added sample templates and testcases for linux_bond, ovs_bond,
dpdkbond using VFs.
2. Set the default values for certain sriov_vf attributes when
its a member of ovs_bond, ovs_bridge
3. Set the default value of promisc for sriov_pf

Change-Id: Icdd2a077f6a996f409bbb2d82b0958b676bc5411

to use ``None`` as a valid value.

commit_message:
Allow to set application name on pool create

When running action "create-pool" it allows to set application
name, avoiding warnings from the health check for "app not set for
the pool"

Change-Id: I6d3e75b488df2606b740617f948d4dbd9ba932b6
Closes-Bug: #1807775

commit_message:
Ensure that newly initialized disks are zero'd

When creating a new encrypted disk, ensure that
we zero the first region to ensure that pvcreate
won't stumble on random artifacts

Closes-Bug: #1783427
Change-Id: Iac45e9c00d093befb893c61a3c3aee70ac4b851a

commit_message:
DNM: debug old compute API service version lookup

We shouldn't be seeing warnings about pre-Ocata API
service versions in master, but we are in the gate, but
surprisingly without related failures. This adds some
additional logging to try and figure out what is going on.

Theory is the context is targeted to cell1 which is why
nova-osapi_compute service isn't in the cell1 db but we
don't 404 looking up the instance in the already-targeted
cell1 context.

Change-Id: I1ebf57f4264621f52c8295b6dcd4f92302ea83fd

commit_message:
Fix service plugins for Queens release

Introduction of the Octavia support for Rocky introduced a regression
for Queens deployments where the LBaaS v2 service plugin is dropped
from the service plugin list.

Provide an explicit list of service plugins for Queens to resolve
this issue.

Change-Id: I8527e68dca01723f6d9bf04b5fe1a605f967244a
Closes-Bug: 1805573
(cherry picked from commit 54fdd53b15e9e78fff4ddfd3115a8560679bae32)

commit_message:
Migration logic for neutron policy-in-code

Neutron is in a process to migrate to policy-in-code.
DevStack needs to be able to handle both cases with and
without policy.json in the neutron repo.

Note that nova assumes neutron API access with admin
so user_name:neutron needs to be included in context_is_admin
to make DevStack work properly. Hopefully this can be cleanup
but this is a separate topic from policy-in-code.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585037/
Change-Id: Id1b0600d92e839ade1790a15c372e82e8e16ee9f

subject: Disable object skew warnings
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-12-11 13:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2018-12-12 13:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-11 13:43:08.000000000', 'message': 'Disable object skew warnings

Ceph will issue a HEALTH_WARN in the event that one pool has a
large number of objects compared to other pools in the cluster:

 "Issue a HEALTH_WARN in cluster log if the average object
  number of a certain pool is greater than mon pg warn max
  object skew times the average object number of the whole
  pool."

For OpenStack deployments, Gnocchi and RADOS gateway can generate
a large number of small objects compared to Cinder, Glance and
Nova usage, causing the cluster to go into HEALTH_WARN status.

Disable this check until the skew evaluation also includes the
size of the objects as well as the number.

Change-Id: I83211dbdec4dea8dca5b27a66e26a4431d2a7b77
Closes-Bug: 1804846
'}]
commit_message:
Disable object skew warnings

Ceph will issue a HEALTH_WARN in the event that one pool has a
large number of objects compared to other pools in the cluster:

 "Issue a HEALTH_WARN in cluster log if the average object
  number of a certain pool is greater than mon pg warn max
  object skew times the average object number of the whole
  pool."

For OpenStack deployments, Gnocchi and RADOS gateway can generate
a large number of small objects compared to Cinder, Glance and
Nova usage, causing the cluster to go into HEALTH_WARN status.

Disable this check until the skew evaluation also includes the
size of the objects as well as the number.

Change-Id: I83211dbdec4dea8dca5b27a66e26a4431d2a7b77
Closes-Bug: 1804846

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-16 06:45:09.000000000', 'message': "lvm: Avoid premature calls to terminate_connection for muiltiattach vols

Previously the LVM volume driver would always call termiante_connection
on the configured target driver regardless of of the associated volume
being attached to multiple instances on the same host. This isn't an
issue for the tgt target driver used by upstream CI as this call is a
noop but does cause the lioadm driver to prematurely remove specific
host ACLs for volumes that are still being used.

This change introduces a simple check to ensure that the target driver
is only called when a single attachment remains that is in turn using
the connector provided by the caller.

Finally as a result of this bugfix the changes introduced by
I84f607de13bc17b00609ad37121d8678f7f4a920 to disable the multiattach
feature when using the lioadm target driver are removed.

Closes-bug: #1786327
Change-Id: Ib5aa1b7578f7d3200185566ff5f8634dd519d020

commit_message:
lvm: Avoid premature calls to terminate_connection for muiltiattach vols

Previously the LVM volume driver would always call termiante_connection
on the configured target driver regardless of of the associated volume
being attached to multiple instances on the same host. This isn't an
issue for the tgt target driver used by upstream CI as this call is a
noop but does cause the lioadm driver to prematurely remove specific
host ACLs for volumes that are still being used.

This change introduces a simple check to ensure that the target driver
is only called when a single attachment remains that is in turn using
the connector provided by the caller.

Finally as a result of this bugfix the changes introduced by
I84f607de13bc17b00609ad37121d8678f7f4a920 to disable the multiattach
feature when using the lioadm target driver are removed.

Closes-bug: #1786327
Change-Id: Ib5aa1b7578f7d3200185566ff5f8634dd519d020
(cherry picked from commit d0b59152ed413f39599ffd1554c0e4e0038431aa)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-12 12:53:16.000000000', 'message': 'MNAIO: Recovery the galera cluster with no gvwstate.dat file

On occasion, a set of saved images may not have a gvwstate.dat file.
Given that the MNAIO tooling is for test purposes only, we can take
the risk of just making one up in order to ensure that the cluster
starts on boot. DO NOT DO THIS IN PRODUCTION!

Change-Id: I1b055ef0d02d77afe03d1a90baa2e6890e986c32
'}]
commit_message:
MNAIO: Recovery the galera cluster with no gvwstate.dat file

On occasion, a set of saved images may not have a gvwstate.dat file.
Given that the MNAIO tooling is for test purposes only, we can take
the risk of just making one up in order to ensure that the cluster
starts on boot. DO NOT DO THIS IN PRODUCTION!

Change-Id: I1b055ef0d02d77afe03d1a90baa2e6890e986c32

[{'created': '2018-12-11 18:39:38.000000000', 'message': 'Remove dead code in objects/resource_provider.py

Coverage testing revealed that a few methods in
objects/resource_provider.py had no coverage. It was initially assumed
this was an artifact of the extraction of placement from nova.

Turns out that the code is not used. It was added in
Ib45fde56706a861df0fc048bbec8a568fd26d85d but then refactoring in
Ib1738fb4a4664aa7b78398655fd23159a54f5f69 made it redundant but the
changes did not remove the unused code.

Change-Id: Id2f0a85b58f191886a2edea8fc195bc2289cbcec
Closes-Bug: #1805858
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dead code in objects/resource_provider.py

Coverage testing revealed that a few methods in
objects/resource_provider.py had no coverage. It was initially assumed
this was an artifact of the extraction of placement from nova.

Turns out that the code is not used. It was added in
Ib45fde56706a861df0fc048bbec8a568fd26d85d but then refactoring in
Ib1738fb4a4664aa7b78398655fd23159a54f5f69 made it redundant but the
changes did not remove the unused code.

Change-Id: Id2f0a85b58f191886a2edea8fc195bc2289cbcec
Closes-Bug: #1805858

To be able to exercise reproducer + f28 + new workflow.

commit_message:
Added validation to docker script verbs

Added a noop verb that does nothing, also added a global-catch that
issues a warning if unknown verb was supplied.

Change-Id: I98ca93457f58d7d9f63188d3642788e5618df62d

commit_message:
Supports router gateway IP QoS

Adds --qos-policy and --no-qos-policy to `openstack router set`:
    --qos-policy <qos-policy> Attach QoS policy to router gateway IPs
    --no-qos-policy Remove QoS policy from router gateway IPs

Adds --qos-policy to `openstack router unset`:
  --qos-policy Remove QoS policy from router gateway IPs

Partially-Implements blueprint: router-gateway-ip-qos
Closes-Bug: #1757044
Change-Id: Ifec3b2cf9bdb59513c8bcd7bd60305506a071192

dbsync issues are resolved now?'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-12-07 20:19:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 33:

> dbsync issues are resolved now?

Yeah I was missing the following snippet in the DB implementation classes [1][2] that introduced the placement::db::begin and placement::db::end anchors:

  Anchor['placement::db::begin']
  ~> Class['placement::db::mysql']
  ~> Anchor['placement::db::end']

Without these the Anchors in deps never triggered placement::dbsync::start. I've pushed the following change to the cookiecutter repo but haven't had time to work on the tests yet.

I9fe3688a10fa453f5e08742e2dfba2e7e35d8392

Was also missing some config from ::nova but that was easy to reintroduce and now things appear to be working well for CentOS. Just waiting on deb packaging to land:

I40a4a7d5d1c969c149c964e67ea24a774619e14f

Ibe2ddd269be064d2bf1196111e1a23b3de887fe7

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604182/33/manifests/db/mysql.pp@69
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604182/33/manifests/db/postgresql.pp@55"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-12-10 17:10:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-12-10 20:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-12-11 09:43:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34: Code-Review-1

failures are all timeouts'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-12 10:40:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I raised https://bugs.launchpad.net/man(ila/+bug/1808127 for the issue in manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-cephfs-nfs-centos-7.  It's a CentOS job and the issue is not due to this change."}, {'account_id': 8056, 'date': '2018-12-12 11:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Ah! okay, it's an issue with bionic builds. Anyway, I think it's better to overwrite the default ganesha.conf instead of appending to it, as you do here, then we don't need to worry about the ganesha community changing the default ganesha.conf in the future."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-11 12:26:45.000000000', 'message': 'Support Ubuntu Bionic LTS release for manila

Continue to use the upstream shaman repos for manila so
we can test changes prior to their inclusion in the distro.

Also overwrite /etc/ganesha/ganesha.conf rather than
appending to it since the file now ships with configuration
that breaks ganesha with CephFS FSAL.

Change-Id: I6db16684fcf1e4ad573e25f0475b283cd85dc2c7
'}]
commit_message:
Support Ubuntu Bionic LTS release for manila

Continue to use the upstream shaman repos for manila so
we can test changes prior to their inclusion in the distro.

Also overwrite /etc/ganesha/ganesha.conf rather than
appending to it since the file now ships with configuration
that breaks ganesha with CephFS FSAL.

Change-Id: I6db16684fcf1e4ad573e25f0475b283cd85dc2c7

commit_message:
nspawn: correct task names

The tasks were incorrectly named, those running on physical host
were labeled as container and vice versa.  This patches fixes that.

Change-Id: I56f5770edc7074e06054e1c79730bf7f9a82c146
(cherry picked from commit 6bd8ee085d3b644b108ae553360cf91d11da9b85)

commit_message:
Base OpenStackClient(OSC) plugin support

This patch enable tackerclient OSC plugin support. This
patch set does the following:
 1. Adds OSC to test-requirement.txt, setup.cfg
 2. Creates the OSC plugin
 3. Builds OSC plugin structure for tacker commands.Such
as: VNF, VNFD, VIM, EXT
 4. Use osc_lib instead of python-openstackclient
 5. Map tacker commands to openstack commands

Change-Id: I54c467f231b1001d0edebd2422a10bb459c06cee
Partial-Implements: blueprint tacker-openstackclient-plugin

We now use the openstack-discuss list for everything, and as announced
we use [$SIGNAME-sig] as the Subject header prefix:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-November/000000.html

Change-Id: I7c049237e966c460369b98d0af384d705ef48524

commit_message:
Fix typo in option name.

We need to set workload_image_url fact when option
'--upgrade-workloadimage https://...' is specified, not when
'--upgrade-workload yes'.

Change-Id: Ia50dc158891cb4f6e18c36d6a3831dbf19e7982d
(cherry picked from commit 353589be3e0a818366ab483c7196b661650097a5)
(cherry picked from commit 3ebad407290aa1b1fd57eb66f83d068365245562)

* Migrate job definitions from centralize project-config to in-repo,
making maintenance easier.
* Change order of default tox envlist in order of likeliness to fail
on a new change (fail-fast strategy).
* Remove pypy from envlist as it was not tested on CI, tox default
set of environment should match CI
* Adds py37 and py36 as they are key as they have changes that could
break older code, like dropping relative imports.

commit_message:
Add missing py37 toxenv and corrected default envlist

* Change order of default tox envlist in order of likeliness to fail
on a new change (fail-fast strategy).
* Remove pypy from envlist as it was not tested on CI, tox default
set of environment should match CI
* Adds py37 to spot possible breakers like dropping relative imports

Change-Id: I4f4abce84f968ff0715abcb5d04fc0014f131fee

commit_message:
Fix standalone containers prep to work with docker_registry_host

Standalone promotion jobs are failing due to the incorrect
sed substitution resulting in the docker_registry_host
not being used.

This review corrects that substitution to allow for using a
specific docker_registry_host and docker_registry_namespace.

Change-Id: Ic5ed378d41cad47e2ae5ea0d515d7a9732773563
